title: Bunch of Keen music conversions
content:
I converted some of the Keen MIDIs to modules for use with fangames and the like. They can be found here:

[url=http://davince.sitesled.com/files/keen-s3m.zip]davince.sitesled.com/files/keen-s3m.zip[/url]
[url=http://davince.sitesled.com/files/keen-it.zip]davince.sitesled.com/files/keen-it.zip[/url]

I'm also making my own Eat Your Veggies remix. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Bunch of Keen music conversions
content:
It's not too difficult, just use Winamps diskwriter plugin and convert the resulting wav file to MP3.

I can do it myself as soon as I get home, if anyone's interested in downloading a bunch of MP3.

Hey, Dav, could I use them as soundtrack for my mods if I like them?------------------

title: Re: Bunch of Keen music conversions
content:
Sure, no problem, but you might wanna wait a bit because I'd like to fix some of these up (fix the timing, instruments etcetera).

It's also way easier to just open the modules in Modplug Tracker and choose file > save to mp3. Or in Modplug Player, save as wav.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

title: Re: Bunch of Keen music conversions
content:
Well, the plugin isn't as good, at least. There's less good support for effects and the sound can't really be tweaked (bass strength, pitch etcetera). And it can give more info on a module. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ____________

title: Re: Bunch of Keen music conversions
content:
I was wrong. I now remember what I did with Jazz Jackrabbit's psms.

I used MilkyTracker to convert them to .xm modules. Now, they play correctly in Modplug (Mikmod doesn't play .psm btw) and no notes are skipped.

Yeah, really. When Modplug plays .psm files, it skips some notes, specifically Jazz Jackrabbit's last CD song (is it songcd8.psm? the one for Lagunicus anyway). It does some ugly jumps and the only workaround is to convert the psm to other module format using an external tool.

Your modules sound good Dav.------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]

title: Re: Bunch of Keen music conversions
content:
Ooh, the main guitar or whatever it is in make_it_tighter.it is a bit off-key... But these sound like the MIDIs from Bobby Prince's page though - didn't you convert any IMFs?

So what format do people use for listening to the Jazz Jackrabbit music? I found a PSM to S3M converter years ago (well, January 1998 according to the dates of my JJ S3M files) and I never noticed any difference in sound quality between the S3M and the in-game music (except the in-game music has more of a surround sound quality to it.)

title: Re: Bunch of Keen music conversions
content:
Packages?! You're kidding, right? You really need to try out Slackware - they supply hardly any programs, so you have no choice but to install everything from source yourself. (Although somewhat ironically Timidity is there.)

Is this really so hard?

<download the .gz file from timidity.sf.net using your preferred method>
$ tar zxvf TiMidity++-2.13.2.tar.gz
$ cd TiMidity++-2.13.2
$ ./configure && make
$ su -c 'make install'

Done! Put some samples and a config file in /usr/local/share/timidity/ and start playing.

What patches do you use for Timidity SM? My current config uses some "Real Sound" 8MB SoundFont as the base, with another 9.2MB SoundFont overlaid on top that I made out of a bunch of samples I picked up (mostly from demo songs on one of the SBLive CDs.) Even though that's only 16MB of samples, I still prefer it to my other alternative, a 142MB "FluidSynth" SoundFont.

title: Re: Bunch of Keen music conversions
content:
I don't know where my patches come from. I've been trying to use FluidSynth, but it crashes the kernel, as TImidity does if it's ALSA port is used by any application but DOSBox. (Probably a kernel bug... 2.6.17-13 Mandriva 2007, I should move to a new kernel).

And not all of us have enough time to build an application from its source code instead of installing a package. Did you know how many hours I spent compiling Wine 0.93? Aproximadetly 1.------------------
SM: "I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?"

title: Re: Bunch of Keen music conversions
content:
I suppose that's the problem if you use packages a lot - they don't install any of the source headers, which sort of locks you into the package system as you can't compile from source if the headers are missing. (Although I believe that's what the "-dev" packages are for.)

And SM, you don't have to sit in front of the PC while it's compiling [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] The kernel takes about an hour too which is why I compile it at "idle" priority, so that I can keep using my PC for other things while it's compiling.

title: Re: Bunch of Keen music conversions
content:
It's difficult to get such headers if you're working offilne.------------------

title: Re: Bunch of Keen music conversions
content: Yet another reason why Slackware (or Gentoo for that matter) is good - all the built in packages include the headers, and of course everything you compile from source installs the headers too [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
